Paatal Lok Season 2 Trailer OUT: Jaideep Ahlawat's Hathiram Faces New Battles In Nagaland, Watch Here - News18
summary:
Paatal Lok Season 2 Trailer OUT: Jaideep Ahlawat's Hathiram Faces New Battles In Nagaland, Watch Here

Published on: January 06, 2025, 19:05 IST

Prime Video has released the highly anticipated trailer for the second season of its acclaimed neo-noir crime series, Paatal Lok, set to premiere on January 17, 2025. The series will explore deeper themes of crime and human nature, featuring returning and new cast members.

  • Jaideep Ahlawat reprises his role as Inspector Hathi Ram Chaudhary in an eight-episode narrative.
  • The plot delves into an investigation involving the disappearance of a migrant worker tied to a drug syndicate in Nagaland.
  • The new season promises a darker narrative filled with moral dilemmas and personal battles.
  • Returning cast includes Ishwak Singh and Gul Panag, alongside new faces such as Tillotama Shome and Nagesh Kukunoor.
“Hathi Ram Chaudhary wasn’t just a character; it became a mirror reflecting the complexities of society and humanity.” - Jaideep Ahlawat

Paatal Lok Season 2 is expected to challenge viewers with its layered storytelling and emotional depth, reinforcing its status as a leading crime drama.
newTitle: Paatal Lok Season 2 Trailer Released: New Challenges Await Jaideep Ahlawat's Hathi Ram in Nagaland

title: Monali Thakur breaks silence on sexual harassment claims on her team, Varanasi concert fiasco: ‘Gross abuse of rights’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Monali Thakur Breaks Silence on Sexual Harassment Claims

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Hindustan Times

Monali Thakur has openly criticized the organizers of her recent concert in Varanasi over serious allegations of sexual harassment and mismanagement that her team faced, emphasizing the urgent need for reforms regarding such incidents.

  • Monali Thakur shut down her Varanasi concert due to poor management and allegations of harassment.
  • She accused the event management team of gross misconduct and exploitation of crew and vendors.
  • She shared her thoughts on social media, urging for better treatment and respect within the live entertainment industry.
  • The singer recalled being subjected to negligence and intimidation during her performance.
  • Thakur called for stricter regulations to protect artists and support staff from exploitation.
“Weaponising such laws for personal vendetta... is both appalling and unacceptable,” Monali stated.

In conclusion, Monali Thakur's statements serve as a powerful reminder of the importance of fair treatment and safety in the entertainment industry, spotlighting the necessity for stronger protective measures for all involved.
newTitle: Monali Thakur Addresses Allegations of Sexual Harassment and Poor Management at Varanasi Concert

title: Pushpa 2 box office report: Allu Arjun's film dethrones Prabhas' Baahubali 2; becomes highest-grossing film in India - Hindustan Times
summary:
Pushpa 2 box office report: Sukumar's Allu Arjun, Rashmika Mandanna, Fahadh Faasil-starrer reached a new milestone within 32 days of release.

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Pushpa 2 has officially dethroned Baahubali 2 to become the highest-grossing film in India, crossing ₹1438 crore in just 32 days since its release.

  • Pushpa 2 grossed ₹1831 crore worldwide.
  • It surpassed the previous record held by Baahubali 2 for over 8 years.
  • Pushpa 2: The Rule was released on December 5, 2024.
  • It is a sequel to the successful 2021 film, Pushpa: The Rise.
  • Pushpa 3 has been announced but no shooting plans are currently in place.
“#Pushpa2TheRule is now Indian Cinema's INDUSTRY HIT with THE HIGHEST EVER COLLECTION FOR A MOVIE IN INDIA,” the team announced.

The success of Pushpa 2 highlights the growing dominance of Indian cinema on a global scale.

title: 'Pushpa 2' worldwide box office collection day 32: The Allu Arjun starrer stands at Rs 1770 crores, on it - TOI Etimes
summary:
'Pushpa 2' worldwide box office collection day 32: The Allu Arjun starrer stands at Rs 1770 crores, on its way to beat 'Baahubali 2' and 'Dangal'

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

'Pushpa 2' has surpassed significant box office milestones, grossing Rs 1770 crores worldwide and positioning itself to challenge records set by other major films.

  • 'Pushpa 2' is now the highest-grossing Indian film at the domestic box office.
  • It currently ranks third for worldwide gross, behind 'Dangal' (Rs 2070 crore) and 'Baahubali 2' (Rs 1790 crore).
  • The film’s collection in India is Rs 1200 crore, eclipsing the Rs 1030 crore of 'Baahubali 2'.
  • The Hindi version of the film outperformed the Telugu version domestically, a notable achievement.
“One never knows!” - potential of exceeding 'Dangal' remains in speculation.

'Pushpa 2' has entered historical territory for Indian cinema, especially in the post-pandemic landscape, as no other Indian movie has come so close to these records in recent times.
newTitle: 'Pushpa 2' Box Office Milestone: Grosses Rs 1770 Crores and Aims for 'Baahubali 2' Record

Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, known for her role as a loving mother, faced backlash for her reaction to her daughter Aaradhya at Mumbai airport after their New Year vacation. A viral video captured the incident, igniting mixed responses online.

  • Aaradhya was seen abruptly jumping, prompting Aishwarya to ask, "Who pushed you?" before pushing her aside.
  • This interaction led to significant criticism regarding Aishwarya's parenting style.
  • Despite criticism, there were supportive comments emphasizing the family's happiness and privacy.
  • Abhishek Bachchan displayed care by escorting Aishwarya and Aaradhya to their car safely.
“Why her daughter is jumping like a kid?”
“She jumps for delight, she is too young and behaves natural. No fuss plz.”

The incident sheds light on the challenges public figures face in their parenting roles, particularly in the public eye, with fans calling for understanding and respect for the family’s privacy.

title: India's most successful actress made ₹10000 cr at box office, more than even Shah Rukh; beat Priyanka Chopra, Alia Bhatt - Hindustan Times
summary:
Deepika Padukone Becomes India's Highest-Grossing Actress with ₹10,200 Crore at Box Office

Publication Date: Jan 06, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Deepika Padukone has emerged as the highest-grossing actress in Indian cinema, eclipsing male counterparts such as Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan by surpassing the ₹10,000 crore milestone at the global box office.

  • Deepika's films have earned a total of ₹10,200 crore globally.
  • She has grossed ₹8,000 crore from Indian films and approximately ₹2,200 crore from her Hollywood film, XXX: The Return of Xander Cage.
  • Key films contributing to her success include Pathaan, Jawan, and Kalki 2898 AD, each earning over ₹1,000 crore.
  • Deepika previously was not in the top 5 highest-grossing actors but climbed to the top in just two years.
  • Her closest competitors are Priyanka Chopra (₹6,000 crore) and Katrina Kaif (₹5,500 crore).
“Deepika’s prolific filmography has allowed her to leapfrog ahead of her male counterparts.”

This milestone solidifies Deepika Padukone's status as a leading figure in Bollywood, with potential for further earnings from upcoming mega films.
newTitle: Deepika Padukone Becomes India's Highest-Grossing Actress with ₹10,200 Crore at Box Office

title: Golden Globes 2025 Highlights: Emilia Perez, The Brutalist, Shogun emerge big winners; All We Imagine As Light misses the cut - The Indian Express
summary:
Golden Globes 2025 Highlights

Publication Date: January 2025   Source: Indian Express

The Golden Globes 2025 took place in Beverly Hills, showcasing the best in television and film. Hosted by Nikki Glaser, this year marked a significant milestone with a woman solo-hosting the event.

  • Emilia Perez led with 10 nominations and won awards for Best Picture, Best Supporting Actress, Best Non-English Feature, and Best Original Song.
  • The Brutalist received 7 nominations and 3 wins, including Best Actor for Adrien Brody.
  • The FX series Shogun won all categories it was nominated for, emphasizing its critical acclaim.
  • India's Payal Kapadia faced a notable loss with All We Imagine As Light not winning in its categories, highlighting challenges for indie filmmakers.
“Films like All We Imagine As Light can reach the same heights that a much bigger film like RRR did.”

The event underscores the importance of inclusivity and broadening the landscape of cinema, showing that language should not limit appreciation for film.
newTitle: Golden Globes 2025 Highlights: Emilia Perez, The Brutalist, Shogun emerge big winners; All We Imagine As Light misses the cut
